QuestDef.Description:
As you enter the city, Rihossa pauses before the ruins of a small temple. "A shrine to Sirdir. The Elemental Lord of Fire. Slain by Curgen thousands of years ago."
"If it is a house of worship you seek, you are on the wrong street." An older man, skin the color of polished jaya wood, steps forward.
"Heh... no god can help me now. What I need is a ship heading south to Kushar," you say.
"Then you are in the right place. But at the wrong time. For Prince Karavox has hired away all our boats and boatbuilders. I hear he plans to assemble a great fleet. I, Feruk of the river clan, am the last shipwright left. And one shipwright cannot build a boat."
"Well then... perhaps you could teach us to build our own ships," you say.
"Perhaps I could. It is not difficult." The old man nods. "Very well - if you will do something for me. It seems all of us in this cursed land need a bit of help. River slags have occupied my mill to the north. Dispatch them, and I will tell you how to build your ships."
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: I accept your deal, Feruk. We will kill the slags - and you will teach us to build the ships we need.
QuestDef.SuccessText:
You stand over the massive corpses, and wipe sweat from your brow.
"You have done well," Feruk says, coming up behind you. Surprised, you turn to face him. "When did you..."
"And now will I keep my promise. I will teach you to build the ships you need - but be warned that the vessels you craft are meant to sail only the shallow waters of the Eastern continent. They will not withstand the treacherous currents of the open water between here and the West, or survive the raging storms of the Southern Meridians."

QuestDef.Description:
"It is as you deserved, Malik..." Ferensu wipes his blood from her hands. "May you rot in hell."
You have barely taken a step out of the village when the Drota woman's voice calls you back. "Hold on, whelp." You turn, and see her standing with a much older man - her arm around his waist, helping to prop him up. "This is Pala. He has something to say to you."
"Something to give you," Pala says, handing you a scrap of papyrus.
The paper feels brittle in your hands - brittle and old.
"It is a fragment of a much larger scroll," Ferensu says. "One that Malik stole from Anox Amokah. One that contains a spell of formidable power. You may be just a whelp, but I can see now that you are truly a mighty warrior. Perhaps you can join the ranks of the few who have mastered it."
The old man nods. "Yes. Yes, this is so. Malik ripped the scroll into pieces. This piece, and three others, which he gave to the chieftains of three villages - Az-Kali, Az-Zuran, and Az-Anoka. He promised them they would each, in turn, learn the spell. But I have spoken with Ferensu, my Lord Relias. I know the danger that rises. Eldrana's prophecy. You must learn this spell, my Lord. You must have its power. But take care - for the leaders of those villages will not surrender the scroll's fragments willingly."
Rihossa speaks, loud enough for all to hear. "My lord, I don't trust this woman. She has yet to prove her loyalty." Ferensu narrows her eyes and gives him a beady glare. "Do what you wish. But... you'd be a fool to pass up such power. Are you a fool?"
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: I need more power. Let's find those scroll fragments.
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: The scroll is unimportant. We must find the Stone.
QuestDef.SuccessText:
You find a flat piece of ground, and lay all four fragments of the scroll down upon it.
Ferensu steps forward, and arranges the pieces so that the writing on them matches up. "This is written in Hallasi. The language of the Verhallem," she says. "An incantation, taken from Varis Reliquaria... It brings forth the power of the Titans themselves. I will teach you the words, that you may pronounce it."
The two of you kneel side by side then, next to the scroll, and begin your work. You feel a great power rise within you. Your chest shudders. "What is... this..."
Ferensu grins a wicked grin. "With this you may now cast the most powerful of all magicks - you can now summon the avatar of one of the almighty titans." Rihossa's mouth is agape. "Man should not wield such power... it is unnatural." Ferensu replies, still grinning. "Perhaps Padar. But this is a war, and in war there are no rules, especially from stodgy old monks. You will learn to respect my methods."

Objective.Text: Find the other three scraps of the papyrus scroll. They are located in three nearby Drota villages.

QuestDef.Description:
You stop in your tracks, unable to believe what you see. Sitting in the midst of a rockfall is a girl in a long blue gown. One that would not have looked out of place on a Queen's lady-in-waiting. She catches sight of you, and rises. "A knight," she says, clasping her hands to her breast. "Mascrinthus be praised."
Rihossa raises an eyebrow. Ferensu raises both. You find your voice. "Who... who are you? And what are you are doing?"
"Noble sir." She smiles. "I am Jayna Var Gellen Sandar, of the House Sandar. I came to these lands in the company of my husband, the noble Ruperd Mar Sandar. He seeks the fabled lost treasure of the Dunnadar, to restore the riches of his house." What kind of a name is Ruperd?
"The treasure of the Dunnadar." The fabled treasure... Just who is this naive girl? "And where is this Ruperd guy now?"
"Alas, he left last eve, seeking firewood, and has yet to return." Jayna slumps to the ground.
Ferensu takes you aside. "In the mountains near here lives an Anathua - an elemental - of great power. And great anger towards the race of man. This Ruperd is no doubt dead already." Even without an elemental around he'd be dead anyways, you think to yourself.
From across the campsite, Jayna speaks once more. "Please, noble sir - may I have your assistance in finding my husband?" Rihossa steps forward "She may be but an reckless child my lord, but we should at least make an attempt to help her." Ferensu shrugs. "What's it going to be?"
QuestDef.ShortTextAccept: Alright, we'll try to find Lord Ruperd for you.
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: Sorry, Jayna. We cannot stay to aid your quest. Good luck.
QuestDef.SuccessText:
As you approach the campsite, Jayna walks forward to greet you. She sees the look on your face. "He is dead, isn't he? Ruperd?" You nod, and she continues. "I had feared as much. He was impulsive, my knight. Our trip here... I know it was foolish, and ill-considered. But it was something he'd always wanted to do. I know that Ruperd died happy. I shall forever cherish his memory. Thank you Relias."
She smiles and turns away, before pausing. "I shall return now to the West. But before I go... I want you to have something."
Jayna goes into her tent and comes out a moment later carrying a small leather satchel. "This was Ruperd's," she says. "I hope you will accept it, and its contents, as thanks from me for your kindness. Good luck on your journey. I can tell your quest is something very important. Maybe we'll see each other again in New Pariden sometime."
Your mouth curls into a bit of a smile. Her eagerness reminds you of Shirayne. Perhaps we should all be so naive as this girl.

GameModifier.Title: Swordmaster of the Dunnadar
GameModifier.Desc:
With the pirates defeated, Rihossa opens the wooden chest. Inside is a pile of gold coins, and a letter bearing the same seal as the chest itself - the staff and the sword.
"This was written by Keeran Kamorg himself!" Rihossa exclaims, eyes wide with excitement. "Swordmaster of the Dunnadar. This is his treasure, my Lord."
You nod. Unfortunately, the treasure isn't quite as impressive as the fables lead you to believe, but the gold will be useful all the same... but the knowledge that Kamorg and the Dunnadar came this way - and that the legend of the Stone's journey to the south is true - that is of far greater value to you, and your quest.
